channel.title: Rusty Relics - Light Painting
channel.description:
I've been into Urban Exploring for a long while, and at the moment I'm really enjoying photographing old vehicles after dark. Here's a couple of my latest shots:
[url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/7098532627/][img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7038/7098532627_20624d6226_z.jpg[/img][/url] [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/7098532627/]Hoarders Cars Light Painting[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/people/jamescharlick/]jamescharlick[/url], on Flickr
[url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/6940541402/][img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7182/6940541402_edcb232bcf_z.jpg[/img][/url] [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/6940541402/]Wolseley 4/44 Graveyard Light Painting[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/people/jamescharlick/]jamescharlick[/url], on Flickr
[url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/6940541114/][img]https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7227/6940541114_5b0375ebbf_z.jpg[/img][/url] [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/6940541114/]Wolseley 4/44 Graveyard Light Painting[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/people/jamescharlick/]jamescharlick[/url], on Flickr
Here's one more, after dark but a different style. I plan to revisit this as soon as I get a clear night sky to reshoot with the neon colours and star trails :slight_smile:
[url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/6883712104/][img]https://farm7.staticflickr.com/6058/6883712104_01c872598a_z.jpg[/img][/url] [url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/jamescharlick/6883712104/]Avro Shackleton Star Trails[/url] by [url=https://www.flickr.com/people/jamescharlick/]jamescharlick[/url], on Flickr
Thought some of you might be interested is all :slight_smile:

item.title: Rusty Relics - Light Painting
item.dc:creator: EccoBlackfin
item.description:
Thanks Jaycee, I shall try that next time I go photo hunting. I tried doing 20 minute exposures and the like, buuut that ended up with something resembling a bright and sunny day in a nuclear blast.
I’m also interested in those Chernobyl pictures, if you get a chance.

item.title: Rusty Relics - Light Painting
item.dc:creator: Jaycee
item.description:
EccoBlackfin:

I like night photography as well, haven’t been able to get the knack of shooting stars yet though. I have a fairly basic lens setup, haven’t gotten around to affording fancier stuff yet
Since you’re into urban exploring, I’ll see if I can dig up some pictures I took of my hometown, Detroit. It doesn’t get much more ruinous than that

Star trails can be tricky, took me a couple of attempts to get the setup right but here’s my advice:

  • Turn off any noise reduction processing in camera so that you can shoot continuously without gaps between your photos.
  • F5.6 is about right for star trails, ideally on a full moon.
  • Shoot towards north for the circle effect.
  • Careful not to get the moon in the shot, try and anticipate where it will move through the sky.
  • 2 - 2 1/2 hours is ideal, my shot was maybe 1 hour 20 and could have done with a bit more.
  • Stacking 30 sec exposures is the best way with digital - long exposures get noisy and you have to be careful not to overexpose the foreground on a full moon otherwise. Stacking means you don’t need to worry.
  • Get a cable release so you don’t have to keep pressing the button every 30 seconds - that gets real old real quick!

I’d love to visit Detroit - and the US in general - at some point, you have some stunning old industry over there. Put some pics up, I’d like to see them

I’ve been to Chernobyl, which was very cool if a little sobering. Can throw up some photos if anyone’s interested.

Read full topic

And this one on a cold, windless morning at India Point in Providence, Rhode Island
